definition: name of a book/reputation as calligrapher
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
Chinese guillemet 《》(punct. used for names of books etc)

sentences.english: So every book catalog has a title card.
sentences.chinese: 这么说，目录柜中每本书都有一张书名卡。

sentences.english: Naturally, the process of coming up with this list wasn't always easy.
sentences.chinese: 当然，拿出这份书名目录的过程中并非总是很容易的。

sentences.english: Stendhal took a lot of time and care in deciding what the title of his novel would be.
sentences.chinese: 司汤达在确定这部作品的书名时还是颇费了一番周折。

sentences.english: I have tried not to become too conscious of why exactly I came up with it.
sentences.chinese: 我已经试着让自己不要太在意捣鼓出这个书名的原因。

sentences.english: Death's End. The title of the final installment gives away what is coming, but whose death?
sentences.chinese: 最终本的书名《死神永生》透露了结局，但谁的死亡？

sentences.english: Do they not like the title?
sentences.chinese: 他们不喜欢我的书名吗？
其他书名费明仪的故事。

sentences.english: The information is here on the syllabus.
Type in the title or the author's name, please.
sentences.chinese: 请键入书名或作者姓名。

sentences.english: The cards are arranged by author and subject.
sentences.chinese: 卡片是根据作者和书名排的。

sentences.english: Can I still use Rock Scissors Paper as the title?
sentences.chinese: 我说，“我还能用石头剪刀布作为书名吗？”

sentences.english: Experience tells us snappy book titles should be treated with caution.
sentences.chinese: 经验告诉我们，吸引人的书名应该谨慎对待。

sentences.english: All the catalogues are in alphabetical order by author, title, and subject.
sentences.chinese: 目录卡标明了图书的作者，书名，出版地点和年份。

sentences.english: Have you checked in the catalog under author and title?
sentences.chinese: 你查过作者和书名目录了吗？

sentences.english: He was a great book, a book is worthwhile to study at home.
sentences.chinese: 他在当时书名很大，是一位颇值得研究的书家。

sentences.english: They are usually called Conquering Prepositions or Conquering Phrases and the like.
sentences.chinese: 那些书通常是战胜介系词或战胜片语之类的书名。

definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
impression of a book/opinion expressed in a book review
reference book consisting of material quoted from many sources, arranged by category (about 600 of which were compiled between the 3rd and 18th centuries in China)
a series of books/a collection of books
